item.title: Common setup
item.description: In the following section you can find example configuration files to achieve specific c3os setups. Single node cluster By default c3os requires multiple nodes. As for the c3os decentralized nature, it requires co-ordination between at least 2 nodes to achieve consensus on IPs, network setting, etc. In order to create single-node cluster, we need to force both the role and the ip by disabling DHCP: c3os: network_token: "...." role: "master" vpn: # EdgeVPN environment options DHCP: "false" ADDRESS: "10.

item.title: Configuring a node after install
item.description: c3os configuration mechanism is all based on cloud-config file. By default, c3os reads in lexicographic order YAML cloud-config files in the /usr/local/cloud-config and /oem directories. For instance, you should be able to see the configuration generated by the interactive-installer in the /oem/99_custom.yaml config file. This mechanism can be used to set and enable persistent configuration on boot. Examples Below you will find some examples on how to use the cloud-config mechanism to enable/disable specific features.
